definition: Yiling (barbarian mound), historical place name in Yichang county 宜昌縣|宜昌县 Hubei, first mentioned in history (after its destruction by Qin) as burial place of the former Chu kings/Yiling district of Yichang city 宜昌市[Yi2 chang1 shi4], Hubei
non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze
mound/tomb/hill/mountain
Yiling district of Yichang city 宜昌市[Yi2 chang1 shi4], Hubei

sentences.english: The Yiling War was a significant war which broke out in the early period of the Three Kingdoms.
sentences.chinese: 夷陵之戰是三國初年影響深遠的一場戰爭。
